runs.comm: weirf start. That's a full toss just outside off and Tamim just defends it
gets some nip into the batsman, Tamim was playing around his front pad. Weathers a mild leg-before appeal. But this was sliding down
banged in short on the body, Tamim fends it away to long leg
good length ball on middle with just a little cut back into the batsman, Sarkar blocks
slashed away to the point boundary. Just on a length, but the mistake was affording the batsman a bit too much width
slants it on a good length and way outside off, this time Sarkar can't get his front leg across far enough to connect. Good carry through to the keeper
starts around the wicket and trumps the advancing Tamim. Good control from Duminy as he pulls the ball outside off and keeps it so the batsman can't get under it
stays back to a fuller delivery on middle and taps it through midwicket

smeared away! Magnificent shot from Sarkar. Full of class. Broke into that special store of timing that only left-handers can locate. Perhaps a touch overpitched, but he drives it through the covers and just admires the shot

that's in the air, but no one's around to threaten it. Held this tossed up delivery back just enough. The batsman was still tempted to go for the cover drive, suddenly realises he isn't to the pitch and checks his stroke
flighted outside off, driven to mid-off where AB gets across in time
pushed through on middle and leg, Tamim goes for a sweep but can't beat short fine leg
ooh, that's a nothing shot. Barely moves his feet but the hands push at the ball. Back of a length delivery zips away past the outside edge and into the keeper's gloves
all it takes is one mistake. Parnell bowls short and wide and Sarkar gets on top of it and cuts it strongly behind point. Another excellent shot.
full and outside off, Sarkar goes for a slog to long-on. Gets a bottom edge as he plays a bit too early
goes short to try and test the batsman, doesn't quite work on this pitch. Sarkar is on the back foot and plays a swivel pull to deep square leg
rushes at the bowler and swings away. Gets a thick outside edge that soars over the point fielder. A little streaky, but that's Tamim's way
moves away from the stumps, Parnell sees red and goes for the yorker. Squeezed into the covers
whipped! Brings that front leg up off the pitch and short-arm pulls it away to deep midwicket. Well timed from Tamim
runs at the bowler, who shortens his length immediately and tucks him up. Tamim looks to send it past fine leg, but can't place it well enough
stays beside the shorter delivery and cuts it through to point
slower ball - offcutter - on middle and leg. Tamim nudges it to midwicket

heaved away to long-on. Sarkar rushes down the track, has to wait a sec for the slower delivery and then directs it wide of Faf. The SA captain slides to push the ball back, but his feet were in contact with the rops

too short and Sarkar has pummeled it away to the right of square leg. He doesn't bother keeping the ball down because he's supremely confident of his placement. The fielder goes for a big dive, he's horizontal with the ground as the ball hurtles past him
good length just outside off, drops it into cover and sets off
eesh! it was a short ball on middle and leg, Sarkar sways his torso away and thrusts his wrists up at the ball. Looking for the ramp, doesn't connect
runs away to his left, Abbott targets him with a short ball. Swung away to mid-on for a single
back of a length to foil the batsman's movement down the track and away from leg stump. Tapped to mid-on
gully leaps up, but it's lobbed him! Sarkar moves away from the ball and uses his wrists again to give it just enoug elevation. Still a tad risky, but he wears it well
full and sliding just a bit down leg. The batsman was making room, of course, so Abbott was just trying to adjust.
banged in short and soaring over the right shoulder of the left-hander as he goes for a pull. Too far down leg
makes room as he runs down the track, Abbott jams in a fuller one and keeps Sarkar quiet
shortish and outside off, Tamim slices it to deep third man
a little too far outside off there and Sarkar slashes it away to the right of deep third man
that's the slower ball outside off, Sarkar brings down an open face and slices it to deep third man
the intent to rush down the track is worrying the bowlers. Parnell slips down leg
looks for the yorker just outside off, hits it. Tamim shoulders arms

that's gone up! The slower, short ball sticks in the pitch just enough. Tamim had committed on the front foot, then to attack the ball. Swings at it, gets a top edge and is caught easily at midwicket.
phew! How's that as a counterpunch. It's a shade down leg and Sarkar leans forward and swings his hands through the line. The timing is again perfect
tossed up just outside off, ends up a full toss actually. Clipped to deep midwicket
flighted on leg stump, worked away to short midwicket
that's better. Loops it up on middle, pushes it down to long-off
another leg side full toss, whipped away to deep midwicket

does him in! Beautiful flight, pulls the batsman out if his crease. Soumya looks to lash it through the covers, and was already looking a little nervous. The ball goes on with the arm and past the outside edge. De Kock is too good of a keeper to miss out

good turn that time. He angles the ball in on leg stump and hits a lovely, uncertain length. Mushfiqur is stuck in the crease as he blocks. Takes the outside edge at the top of the bat and jumps away past slip. Top first over from Leie
pushed through on a length and just outside off, defended to cover
goes back to cut a good length ball that comes on with the arm. Just misses off stump, misses the bat comfortably and the keeper fumbles it as well
tapped away to long-on. A little short that time from Duminy
tosses it up on off stump, Mushy goes for the booming drive through cover but only manages an inside edge. Not quite enough width and JP gets some drift in as well
picked away off his pads as he takes advantage of a length ball behind square leg
some turn, off a shorter length. Shakib jumps back in his crease and taps it through the covers
a touch quicker on leg stump, it's the googly so that's a good line for it. Not enough turn there because it was pitched too close to the batsman. Driven to long-on
doesn't pick the other one! Mushy goes for another cover drive, gets an inside edge and de Kock has no chance
a little shorter on off stump, Shakib scoops it away towards fine leg
outside edge! Mushfiqur is trying a bit too much too early here. The orthodox legspinner now and he continues to play against the turn. Big sweep takes the top edge and balloons over slip
closes the face too early and the leading edge pops up towards point. Leie is spinning circles around Mushy right now
that's better. Eases forward to a tossed up ball outside off and drives through cover. Much more circumspect
flighted on off stump, Mushy keeps the front leg away and slaps it down the ground
he's overstepped! Not the worst ball though, decent length to force the advancing Shakib to be quiet an defend.
free hit has become a dot. Tosses it up and puts it wider of off stump. Shakib bunts it back at the bowler
flighted outside off, Shakib slaps it in the air but it doesn't carry to cover
that's a flatter, quicker delivery outside off. Shakib cuts it away to deep point
shortish and on off stump, Mushy leaps back and away from the ball to enable his late cut. Beautiful batting. Leie at short third man fumbles
a cut to deep point again as Duminy goes to his staple shortish and quick deliveries on off stump

he's knocked Shakib over straight away! The left-hander was targeting the left-armer, races down looking for a six over long-on. Made decent connection, but Rossouw is so cool on the boundary. Leaps up just perfectly to take a very well judged catch. First that late blitz. now this catch. He's making some big-impact contributions
flighted in on middle and off, Sabbir presses forward to block
flighted on middle and leg, Sabbir nudges it behind square leg

catch it is the cry,and oopsy, Abbott's slipped on the long leg boundary. He was running across towards square leg, forgetting the ball would pitch and spin. As he tries to redirect himself, he falls on his face and the ball dribbles to the boundary
a little short and on off stump, Mushy slaps it away to short third man
flighted on middle and leg, turned away through midwicket
loops it up and gets it to dip in off stump suddenly. Mushfiqur just about jams his bat down in time

that's beautiful! Leie can have his hands on his head all he wants, but the inside out cover drive is one of his strengths and Mushfiqur has timed this perfectly. Abbott leaps up on the boundary to try and catch it. No such luck
flighted on middle and leg, eased down to long-on

slugged away to Miller at deep midwicket! Sabbir was reaching for the ball in front of him and outside off. Goes for a slog sweep. Connects decently, but he's not placed it. The fielder runs forward and dives to complete a pretty good catch

wicket off a full toss and Mushy's gone! Leie's having a ball! He was looking to slice it away over short cover, didn't get the elevation he wants. Rossouw does though, good leaping catch. Bangladesh slipping away again
flighted outside off, driven to cover
doesn't move his feet as he looks to glide a good length ball through point. Beaten by the turn and bounce. His own fault for allowing it to turn and bounce

eesh! just when I said he likes pressure. Jumps down the track to lift it in the air. Looks nothing more than a chip, which means that's a poor choice of shot with long-off around. Rossouw again, races in and takes an easy catch.
flighted outside off, driven past the bowler's dive to his left
flighted on and around off stump, defended
shortish and outside off, slapped into the covers
keeps to his crease against a length ball on leg stump, worked away to midwicket
full toss just outside off from Duminy to start his new spell, turned to long-on
just lobs short midwicket! Good length ball digs into the pitch and bounces up as Das looks to clip it away. Nearly succumbs
flighted outside off, Das was looking to drive through the covers, ends up with an inside edge that sends the ball over the bowler's head
pushed through on off stump, gets some turn as well. He works it off the back foot behind square leg
inside edge! But it squirts away past the stumps to short fine leg. It was a fuller delivery outside off, he really should have been coming forwrad
great work from QdK down the leg side. Moves quickly to his left, after being blinded by the batsman sweeping. Controls it nicely
nips down the track and rolls his wrists on a flighted delivery outside off. Seemed like he was just looking for a single, but he timed the shot so very well
hammered away! Talukdar dances down the track and heaves it away down the ground. Vicious strike, settles into the second tier stands over long-on
saw the shorter ball coming a mile away and cuts it to deep point
wears it on the chest. Phangiso pulls the length back and adjusts the pace as well. The batsman was looking to swat it away, but it's too much for him

lovely, well-judged catch from Wiese! Races quite a distance from long-on, has to worry about Leie in his eyeline as well because he was running in from deep midwicket. Makes sure to concentrate only on the ball though and takes it excellently. Another down the track swipe doesn't pay off for Bangladesh
good length on middle, clipped to midwicket
a little turn away from the bat, Talukdar moves to the leg side to try and smear it through the covers. Ends up with an inside edge
shortish and outside off, dabbed to point. An overthrow from there gets Mashrafe a couple of runs
full and angled in on middle, Mashrafe turns it to short fine leg to give the strike back to the specialist batsman
fuller and slower just outside off, tucked to long-on
uses the closed face to give some work to short fine leg. Picks it from off stump, but Wiese's angle helps the shot out
banged in short and outside off to adjust to Talukdar's strides down the track. He reaches out to bunt the ball through point. Ends with a bottom edge to the keeper
flayed to deep midwicket as Wiese keeps it short, and slow
goes back to a good length ball on middle and leg and tucks it through midwicket
skips down to the pitch to slam a flighted delivery into the sightscreen. Mirpur roars
another! The bowler goes flatter and on leg stump, but Mashrafe doesn't care. Gets down the track and mauls it to the long-on boundary as well. Flat hit
slugs it to deep midwicket. Phangiso does well to slow the ball down and toss it wide of off stump. Brave spin bowling
that was quick and flat on leg stump because Rony was rushing down the track. Pushed to long-on
saw Mash coming down again and bowled it full and wide. Tall man the Bangladesh captain, so he manages to reach it and smear it to cover

ooh, he's dropped it. Did well to dig the ball in and swindle the batsman of his timing. Poor shot, going for the pull off the front foot when there was no room. His the splice and goes back to the bowler, who gets only his finger tips to it. Came back a little slower than he thought, I think
bang! Saw Mashrafe moving outside leg to scoop, Abbott makes that impossible with a leg-stump yorker that hits its mark
another yorker just outside off, Sunny pushes it into the covers. Good skills from Abbott
banged in short there, Rony pulls to deep square leg
back of a length and outside off, Sunny slices it to point
full on middle, squeezed away to square leg. Is he getting some reverse here?
shortish and outside off, nudged to deep midwicket for a couple
shortish and outside off, taps to extra cover
swinging in on leg stump, Sunny meets it on the full and clips it to short fine leg
short and wide, Talukdar slashes and finds deep third man
has Sunny in a spot of bother with a short ball that holds in the pitch and then jumps up at him. He fends it away to point and enjoys an overthrow
slides a good length ball way down leg
top-class stuff from De Kock! This is a full toss that kisses the pads and looks set to be four leg byes, but he moves to his right quickly and pulls off a big dive to keep it in

his yorkers are quite something. Tinged in with deadly reverse swing. This one began outside off, then veers in looking for the base off stump. Rony realises the threat too late. Tries to save himself. But this is too good a ball to be denied a wicket
bouncer to greet Mustafizur. Another great delivery, dug in quite short an directed at the batsman's helmet. The pull is more like an evasive action and is well beaten
off stump uprooted! South Africa win the series. Abbott has made a strong claim to be a permanent fixture in South Africa's attack. Mustafizur looks to slap it through the covers, too good for him
